title: Jennifer Aniston makes Instagram debut in style with complete Friends reunion photo

Jennifer Aniston, 50, has signed up to Instagram and delighted fans with an epic Friends reunion cast snap.

The actress, who shot to fame as Rachel Green in the American sitcom, uploaded her first post onto the social networking site on Tuesday.

The blonde star selected a selfie for her social media debut that showed her smiling alongside her Friends co-stars David Schwimmer, Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, Matt LeBlanc and Matthew Perry - the first ever full reunion snap of the actors.

She playfully captioned the offering: "And now we’re Instagram FRIENDS too. HI INSTAGRAM."

Jennifer decided to write in her bio: "My friends call me Jen."

So far, the age-defying beauty is following 81 people and has racked up a massive 141,000 followers.

(Image: WireImage)

Fans of the former wife of Brad Pitt took to the comments to share their excitement of her joining the picture upload service.

One penned: "I love this so much" alongside a crying face.

Another added: "This is a moment!."

Some gushed: "our besties all together!!!!!" and "Oh yeah mama!! Woooohooooo."

(Image: Instagram)

Jennifer's social media debut comes after she admitted she is not keen on taking part in a Friends reboot.

During an interview on Howard Stern's Sirius XM Radio, the actress confessed that while she missed the show, a reboot wasn't a good idea.

She told the radio host: "We all miss it every day. I would be nothing without it […] If there’s a reboot of the show, it won’t be as good as what it was, so why do it? It would ruin it."

Her words echoed those of Friends co-creator Marta Kauffman who has always insisted that a reboot would never happen.

(Image: NBC via Getty Images)

(Image: Getty Images)

She famously said: "The show is about a time in your life when your friends are your family. It's not that time anymore. All we'd be doing is putting those six actors back together, but the heart of the show would be gone."

Aniston was also asked about her dating life while on the radio show - but she firmly shifted the conversation back to her work.

In reply to a question about whether she was seeing anyone since her split from former husband Justin Theroux in 2017, she stated: "I’m very busy. For now. I’m promoting [ The Morning Show ]. I’m prepping for next season."
description: The actress has joined the social networking site with a Friends cast reunion picture - and they are all there
